definition: to strike out/strikeout (baseball, softball)/(Tw) to ditch/to eliminate from consideration
to shake/to flap/to vibrate/to resonate/to rise up with spirit/to rouse oneself

sentences.english: He whiffed 10 Mets in a game last June 17 at Yankee Stadium.
sentences.chinese: 去年他在洋基球场上三振掉了10颗梅子。

sentences.english: I struck out three times during the game.
sentences.chinese: 我在比赛中被三振出局。

sentences.english: First paragraphs can often be struck out.
sentences.chinese: 第一段落经常会被三振出局。

sentences.english: But most notably for Wang, he set a career high with 10 strikeouts.
sentences.chinese: 但对王最值得一提的，是他创生涯新高的10次三振。

sentences.english: One day he struck out three times in one game.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，他在一场比赛中三次被三振出局。

sentences.english: In baseball, strikeouts are recorded using the letter "K."
sentences.chinese: 在棒球中，三振出局使用字母K来记录。

sentences.english: By the end of the game, his fastballs had produced seven strikeouts.
sentences.chinese: 在比赛结束前，他的快速球造成了七次三振出局。

sentences.english: The answer, increasingly, seems to be that they'll have to strike out on their own.
sentences.chinese: 看起来他们势必将会自己三振出局。

sentences.english: He struck out four of his first five batters .
sentences.chinese: 他面对的投五名打者他三振了四名。

sentences.english: I made an undig­nified three. But far worse was the manner of my failure.
sentences.chinese: 我被可耻地三振出局，但更糟糕的是我的错误。

sentences.english: The next pitch jackknifed under his bat for strike three.
sentences.chinese: 而下一球，让小波挥棒三振他出局。

sentences.english: In other words, he's TRYING not to strike people out.
sentences.chinese: 换句话说，他是在尝试不要去三振打者。

definition: to defend the crown (in sports championship)
